cards.name: Vamp
cards.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may pay X[Credits] to force the Corp to lose up to X[Credits], then take 1 tag.
cards.flavor: There was a certain schadenfreude about throwing away your credits.

cards.name: Liberated Account
cards.text: Place 16[Credits] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it. [Click]: Take 4[Credits] from Liberated Account.
cards.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.

cards.name: Satellite Uplink
cards.text: Expose up to 2 cards.
cards.flavor: T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.

cards.name: e3 Feedback Implants
cards.text: Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1[Credit] to break 1 additional subroutine on that ice.
cards.flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and autonomic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.

cards.name: Compromised Employee
cards.text:
1[Recurring Credit]
Use this credit during traces.
Gain 1[Credit] whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.

cards.name: Notoriety
cards.text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
cards.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.

cards.name: Snowball
cards.text: 1[Credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[Credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
cards.flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" -Chaos Theory

cards.name: Dyson Mem Chip
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit], +1[Link]

cards.name: Encryption Protocol
cards.text: The trash cost of all installed cards is increased by 1.
cards.flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.

cards.name: Sherlock 1.0
cards.text: The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Sherlock 1.0. [Subroutine] Trace4- If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack. [Subroutine] Trace4- If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.

cards.name: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection
cards.text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.

cards.name: Fetal AI
cards.text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this abiilty if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2[Credits].

cards.name: Trick of Light
cards.text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.

cards.name: Sensei
cards.text: [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, each piece of ice encountered except Sensei gains "[Subroutine] End the run" after all its other subroutines.
cards.flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.

cards.name: Big Brother
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Give the Runner 2 tags.

cards.name: ChiLo City Grid
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful trace during a run on this server, give the Runner 1 tag. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.

cards.name: Power Grid Overload
cards.text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn. Trace2- If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.

cards.name: Amazon Industrial Zone
cards.text: Whenever you install a piece of ice protecting this server, you may immediately rez it, lowering its rez cost by 3. Limit 1 region per server.

cards.name: Executive Retreat
cards.text: When you score Executive Retreat, place 1 agenda counter on it and shuffle HQ into R&D. [Click], hosted agenda counter: Draw 5 cards.

cards.name: Freelancer
cards.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash up to 2 resources.
cards.flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.
